definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: The dwarf put his hand to his great flapped ear, and counterfeited the closest attention.
sentences.chinese: 矮子用手张起他那大边的耳朵，装出密切注意的样子。

sentences.english: SO watch out for NZD volatility later this evening.
sentences.chinese: 所以，请密切注意纽元今晚晚些时候的波动。

sentences.english: Waters keeps an eye on the trekkers and shares his tales.
sentences.chinese: 华特兹密切注意我们这群旅人的安危并分享他的故事。

sentences.english: You must monitor the latest intelligence on armaments.
sentences.chinese: 你们必须密切注意有关军备的最新情报。

sentences.english: Pay close attention to these innovations.
sentences.chinese: 请密切注意这些创新做法。

sentences.english: Ina has her eye out for bargains.
The police have been instructed to keep an eye out for pick-pockets at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 已经指示警察密切注意集市上的扒手。

sentences.english: Keep an eye on bulletin boards and an ear out for announcements to avoid surprises and disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 密切注意公告板，还要注意通知，以避免吃惊和失望。

sentences.english: Capital management especially needs to advent meticulously the trends of the idle fund.
sentences.chinese: 资本管理方面尤其需要密切注意游资流动的动态。

sentences.english: Pay close attention, this story might be about you.
sentences.chinese: 请密切注意，这个故事可能跟你有关。

sentences.english: State officials will be paying close attention to any problems reported with voting machines. (See “Electronic Voting Technology Has Not Won Trust of U.S. Voters.”)
sentences.chinese: 州政府官员将密切注意投票机出问题的报道。

sentences.english: The watchful snatcher dispatched a batch of combatants to the hatch.
sentences.chinese: 密切注意的绑架者发送一批战士到舱口盖。

sentences.english: Politicians pay close attention to right-track/wrong-track indicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家密切注意是否走上正轨的指标。

sentences.english: We trust that our letter will receive your close attention.
sentences.chinese: 相信我方去函能引起贵方密切注意。

sentences.english: The police are carefully watching the movements of the suspicious character carefully.
sentences.chinese: 警察密切注意著那个可疑人物的行动。

sentences.english: Pay close attention to advertising wording and images, too.
sentences.chinese: 同时，密切注意广告的措辞和图像。

definition: must/to need to/to be sure to
(so as) to avoid/to prevent/(just) in case
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
